Class Trie

  • java.lang.Object
    • Trie

  • public class Trie
extends java.lang.Object
    The Trie class is the underlying data structure for the dictionary of the system. It is composed of Node objects in a special tree structure that allows quicker dictionary search and retrieval.

    The Trie structure executes fuzzy searching in the dictionary by using Dynamic Programming (DP) algorithms and memoization tables to reuse computation results from previous substrings. The tree structure further optimizes this DP approach by allowing the memoization table to be split up into rows. We store each of these rows in each Node object.

      Creates a Trie object using a Node array.

        public Trie(Node[] graph)

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String query)
        The Trie's implmentation of exact string matching in a dictionary.
        Parameters:
        query - The search string that will be searched in the Trie.
        Returns:
        True if the query string was found in the Trie; False if otherwise.

      • computeDP

        public java.lang.Object[] computeDP(java.lang.String query,
                           int threshold)
        This method is used to compute the values of the DP memoization tables in the Node objects given a query string. The algorithm is optimized by pruning the search and computation space by providing a threshold value so that the program does not compute the values for substrings that are "too far" from the query string. The output of this method is the cut point Node and string index of the word in the dictionary that contains the highest score.
        Parameters:
        query - The query string to be used.
        threshold - The threshold value which will limit the computation.
        Returns:
        An object array containing the cut point Node and string index.

      • backTrack

        public java.lang.String backTrack(int id)
        This method "backtracks" up the Trie to rebuild the dictionary word that is represented by the Node sequence.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Node object at the end of the word.
        Returns:
        The rebuilt String that the Node sequence represents.

      • score

        public static double score(int edit,
           int lcs)
        This method defines the scoring of each substring based on its Edit Distance and LCS value with a query string.
        Parameters:
        edit - The computed Edit Distance of the substring.
        lcs - The computed LCS value of the substring.
        Returns:
        The score that will be assigned to the substring.
